sn35.151:1.1: The Vinaya establishes that a newly ordained monastic should live in dependence on a mentor (uppajjhāya) and/or a “tutor” (ācariya) for at least the first five years. If they considered qualified at that point they may be released from dependence. Here the Buddha plays with this idea, inverting the standard meaning.
sn35.151:1.6: The Buddha reveals the pun: the defilements “reside within” (anto vasanti) as a “resident pupil” (antevāsi) lives with the teacher.
sn35.151:1.8: The defilements “master” (samudācaranti) them like a “teaching master” (ācariya).
